item.title: Remembering the Pioneer Club: A Vintage Las Vegas Legend
item.description:
From Restaurant to Vegas Icon

The corner of Fremont and First Street in Las Vegas holds a special place in the cityâ€™s history, and much of that is thanks to the Pioneer Club. Believe it or not, the building itself dates back to 1918, originally serving as a restaurant. But its true rise to fame began in 1942 when it transitioned into a unique establishment - a club and cocktail lounge. This marked the genesis of what would become a beloved Las Vegas institution.
